business.headline: GST rate cuts to benefit you, but categorisation will decide how muchThe GST Council, which will meet for its 56th session in New Delhi on 3–4 September, is expected to discuss widening the nil-rate slab, merging rates, and reducing GST on selected items currently taxed at 18%.

Economy to grow 6.3-6.8% in FY26, US tariffs pose downside risk: GovernmentChief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran said that high tariffs are expected to be "short-lived" as both countries are in talks for the removal of the 25 per cent penal tariff and a subsequent bilateral trade deal.
Jo Hai Thama Sa, Chal Niklega: Vijay Shekhar Sharma at Paytm AGMPaytm's AGM today began not with data or charts, but with Vijay Shekhar Sharma reciting a Hindi poem by Anand Ji from Varanasi.

Adani Airports to invest Rs 10,000 crore in Lucknow expansionThe investment will be made in phases and will focus on increasing capacity, modernising facilities, adopting new technology, and improving cargo infrastructure.

India's GDP growth accelerates to 7.8% in Q1 FY26, beats estimatesThe latest GDP data shows that India's economy started the financial year 2025-26 on a strong note, with overall GDP growth ahead of expectations amid global headwinds.

Reliance AGM: Why shares dropped over 2% despite Jio IPO buzz and AI pushAddressing shareholders, Mukesh Ambani promised that Jio has the potential to deliver value comparable to global leaders and called the IPO an "attractive opportunity" for investors.

Reliance teams up with Meta to bring enterprise AI solutions to IndiaThe joint venture will create AI platforms and tools based on Meta's open-source Llama models. These will be designed to help businesses improve efficiency across areas like customer service, sales, IT operations, finance, and more.
Sensex closes 271 points lower, Nifty below 24,500; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 270.92 points to close at 79,809.65, while the NSE Nifty lost 74.05 points to end at 24,426.85.

Jio IPO likely to make Dalal Street debut by 1st half of 2026Jio IPO: The announcement was made by Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani in his address to investors at the conglomerate's 48th Annual General Meeting (AGM).

Rupee falls to all-time low of 87.97 amid US tariff concernsA weaker rupee against the yuan could offer a partial cushion for exporters hit by US tariffs, making Indian products relatively cheaper compared to Chinese rivals. It could also help narrow India's trade deficit with China.

Reliance AGM 2025: Will Mukesh Ambani announce Jio IPO?The main talking point at the Reliance AGM will be information about the much-awaited initial public offerings (IPOs) of Jio Platforms and Reliance Retail finally get a timeline.

Sanjeev Sanyal hints at major overhaul in EPFO with 3.0 rolloutEconomist Sanjeev Sanyal has signalled that the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is gearing up for a major transformation, with the much-awaited EPFO 3.0 promising faster, simpler, and more digital-first services.

entertainment.headline: Farah Khan's cook Dilip tries to sell her iPhone for Rs 5-6K. WatchFarah Khan's cook Dilip stole the show on 'Aunty Kisko Bola' with his trademark humour. He made a brief yet impactful appearance by trying to sell an iPhone, unaware of its cost. He later ran away when an audience member reminded him of the phone's actual value.

Julia Roberts defends MeToo-themed film After The Hunt at Venice Film FestivalActors Julia Roberts and Luca Guadagnino addressed questions on feminism and complicity at the Venice Film Festival. Their film 'After The Hunt' sparks debate on MeToo and challenges traditional narratives around misconduct.

Baaghi 4 trailer: Tiger Shroff, Sanjay Dutt lock horns in violent revenge-dramaActor Tiger Shroff has returned as Ronnie in the new instalment of his action series 'Baaghi'. The recently released trailer for 'Baaghi 4' shows him battling the scariest antagonist, played by actor Sanjay Dutt.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 6: Tanya picks Kunickaa as captain, Gaurav refuses to cookTanya Mittal chose actor Kunickaa Sadanand as the first captain of 'Bigg Boss 19' in episode 6. The episode later saw Kunickaa clashing with Gaurav Khanna after he refused to cook. Farrhana Bhatt, who was in the secret room, also returned to the main house in the latest episode.

Cinematographers, the art of adding soul to film, and job that often goes unnoticedCinematographers shape how the audience feels in every scene of a film through light, framing, and movement. On this Cinematic Saturday, let's discuss how they can truly make or break a film.

Allu Arjun heads to Hyderabad after grandmother's death, Ram Charan cancels shootAllu Kanakaratnam, grandmother of actor Allu Arjun, died at 94 due to age-related causes. Actor Ram Charan cancelled 'Peddi' shoot, following her death.

Param Sundari box office Day 1: Sidharth-Janhvi's film earns over Rs 7 crore'Param Sundari', featuring actors Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, had a modest opening on its first day. The film released on August 29, 2025.

Metro In Dino OTT release: When and where to watch Anurag Basu's love storyDirector Anurag Basu's 'Metro…In Dino' (2025) is now streaming on Netflix India from August 29. The film is a spiritual sequel to his 2007 romantic-dramedy 'Life...In A Metro'.

Bhojpuri star Pawan Singh inappropriately touches co-star at event, faces backlashBhojpuri star Pawan Singh is trending for all the wrong reasons after a video shows him touching co-star Anjali Raghav without consent during a promotional event.

Chiranjeevi fan cycles 300 km to meet him, actor promises support for her childrenA woman named Rajeshwari pedalled all the way from Andhra Pradesh to Hyderabad to meet her idol, Chiranjeevi. The fan travelled 312 kilometres from Adoni to meet the star.

Ryan Reynolds' Instagram misses Blake Lively posts, split rumours swirlFans are speculating that Ryan Reynolds may have archived photos of Blake Lively on Instagram after failing to post for her birthday, further fuelling rumours about the state of their marriage.

Shodha review: Intriguing case overshadowed by lacklustre resolutionRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025Shodha Kannada series review: Starring Pawan Kumar, Siri Ravikumar and Arun Sagar in the lead, 'Shodha' presents a case set in Madikeri, Karnataka where a family deals with trust issues and mistaken identities.

Odum Kuthira Chadum Kuthira review: Fahadh Faasil in painfully unfunny comedyRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025Odum Kuthira Chadum Kuthira movie review: Director Althaf Salim's romantic comedy, starring Fahadh Faasil and Kalyani Priyadardhan, is an absurd romantic comedy that struggles to find its footing. Surprisingly, even Fahadh Faasil isn't able to elevate it.

Amaal Mallik recalls ex-partner calling him on her wedding day on Bigg Boss 19Amaal Mallik shared on 'Bigg Boss 19' how his ex-girlfriend called him on her wedding day, but he refused to go out of respect for his parents.

Jimin-Song Da-eun saga exposes toxic fan culture: Why idols in love are punishedBTS Jimin and Song Da-eun dating rumours sparked backlash among fans. In this week's K-fix, we will dive deep inside K-pop's toxic fan culture - no dating rules, and why idols keep apologising for falling in love.

Tu Pehli Tu Aakhri: SRK calls new The Ba***ds of Bollywood track his favouriteShah Rukh Khan expressed his fondness for the new track 'Tu Pehli Tu Aakhri' from 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. The series will premiere on September 18 on Netflix.

George Clooney, Adam Sandler's Jay Kelly gets standing ovation at Venice premiereActor George Clooney braved a sinus infection and rain for the premiere of Jay Kelly at Venice International Film Festival. His co-star Adam Sandler was also present at the screening as the movie received a standing ovation from the audience.

Do You Wanna Partner trailer: Tamannaah, Diana run beer start-up in quirky dramedyThe trailer for the comedy-drama 'Do You Wanna Partner', featuring actors Tamannaah Bhatia and Diana Penty, was released on August 29. The series highlights female friendship and entrepreneurship in a male-dominated society.

Param Sundari review: Sidharth-Janhvi can sell Kerala trips, not loveRelease Date:Fri Aug 29, 2025'Param Sundari' review: Tushar Jalota's romantic comedy starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor delivers stunning Kerala visuals and good music, but lacks chemistry and a compelling story. Yet another predictable and forgettable Bollywood love story.

general news.headline: 'Human GPS' Bagu Khan, behind over 100 infiltration bids, killed in J&KSecurity forces killed Bagu Khan, aka Samandar Chacha, the "human GPS" of terror, in Gurez, ending his decades-long role in over 100 infiltration attempts.

Pointless rupture: The Economist's stinging take on Trump tariffs on IndiaThe Economist argues that alienating India was a 'grave mistake' by the US, and it could well be an opportunity for New Delhi to realise its claim of being a 'superpower-in-waiting'.

'Trump is dead': Why US President has become an unlikely trend'Trump is Dead' took X by storm on Saturday with more than 56,900 posts at the time of writing this report, fuelling ongoing speculation about the 79-year-old US President's health.

Ramen bowls, pashmina shawl: Modi's gifts to Japanese PM, his wifePM Modi gifted Japanese PM Shigeru Ishiba a vintage moonstone bowl set with silver chopsticks, blending Indian artistry with Japanese culinary traditions, and a handwoven Kashmiri shawl in a painted papier-mache box.

Why RSS doesn't want India to become JapanRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat doesn't want India to become Japan, which saw a drop of almost a million people last year, the biggest for any country. This has implications for the very existence of the country. With similar concerns in mind, Bhagwat said every Indian should have three children in their family.

One person, multiple IDs: Congress accuses BJP of 'vote chori' in Gujarat tooGujarat Congress chief Amit Chavda alleged large-scale voter roll manipulation in Gujarat's Navsari, claiming 30,000 fake or duplicate entries, and demanded a full verification of the electoral rolls.

Rahul Dravid steps down as head coach of Rajasthan RoyalsIndian Premier League (IPL) franchise Rajasthan Royals announced on Saturday that it has ended its association with head coach and former skipper Rahul Dravid.

Trump tariffs wreak havoc at home, Americans cry over price riseDespite promises to lower costs and make America affordable again, Donald Trump's tariffs and tax policies are driving up grocery and electricity prices in the US. This is adding hundreds of dollars to the household expenses of Americans. Experts warn the trend could worsen, hitting low-and middle-income families hardest.

Nature's fury in 2025 is human-engineered. Let's accept itIndia's recent devastating floods are far from natural disasters happening in isolation. They have the unmistakable imprint of human activities.

BRS's KTR detained, walks out of police vehicle, reaches Telangana SecretariatIn a dramatic turn of events, KTR stepped down from the detention vehicle and made his way to the Telangana Secretariat, intensifying the political showdown with the ruling Congress. The BRS has been pressuring the Revanth Reddy government, accusing it of mishandling fertiliser supply and pushing farmers into distress.

Jolly LLB 3 case: The irony of a courtroom comedy standing trial in a real courtJolly LLB 3, starring superstar Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi, is facing legal challenges even before its much-awaited September 19 release. Several lawyers and bar associations have filed Public Interest Litigations (PILs), alleging that the film mocks the judiciary and disrespects the legal profession.

Bank manager in Kochi bans beef in canteen, staff did this nextBank employees protested outside Canara Bank's Kochi office by serving beef to oppose an alleged beef ban imposed by the regional manager.

Natural vs lab-grown: Can Taylor Swift's ring shift the diamond debate?Taylor Swift's 'rare' old mine brilliant-cut engagement ring comes at a time when lab-grown diamonds are posing a strong challenge to the natural diamond industry. Could her choice swing the trend in quintessential 'Taylor Swift Effect' style?

Family of 7 killed in Reasi, 4 dead in Ramban as heavy rain batters J&KA week of pounding rain has battered Jammu and Kashmir, leaving highways cut off, villages marooned, and hundreds stranded, with fresh landslides in Reasi and cloudbursts in Ramban.

Australian politician raises fist at journalist during presser. Video goes viralA video of an Australian politician raising a fist at a journalist during a press conference outside Queensland state parliament in Brisbane went viral on social media.

Lalit Modi, shame on you: Sreesanth's wife fumes over releasing Harbhajan slap videoBhuvneshwari Sreesanth has criticised Lalit Modi and Michael Clarke for reopening the 2008 slap-gate scandal. The resurfacing of unseen footage has sparked fresh debate and controversy in cricket circles.

US shooter 'obsessed with killing children' exposes a teen mental health crisisRobin Westman, the 23-year-old who opened fire at a Minneapolis school, left behind a chilling trail of journals, trial runs, and a disturbing obsession with harming children. If this is what obsession looks like in adolescence, then maybe it's time we stopped treating teenage mental health as a soft issue.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

American brand is in the toilet: Ex-US security advisor on tariffs on IndiaFormer US NSA Jake Sullivan criticised Trump's heavy tariffs on India, saying they damage US-India ties, undermine America's global standing, and push New Delhi closer to China.

Portugal set to hand Diogo Jota's number 21 kit to his close friend Ruben NevesPortugal will honour the late Diogo Jota by passing his iconic No. 21 jersey to close friend Rúben Neves, with coach Roberto Martinez calling it a gesture to keep Jota's dream alive on the pitch.

Cinematographers, the art of adding soul to film, and job that often goes unnoticedCinematographers shape how the audience feels in every scene of a film through light, framing, and movement. On this Cinematic Saturday, let's discuss how they can truly make or break a film.

Indore student runs away from home to marry boyfriend, returns wedded to anotherShraddha told police she had planned to elope with her boyfriend Sarthak, but when he failed to show up at the station, she boarded a train to Ratlam and reconnected with another lover, Karandeep, an Indore-based electrician.

US court junks Trump tariffs as illegal, but he won't relent just yetThe US appeals court ruling on Trump tariffs will not take effect until October 14 to give the administration time to take the battle to the Supreme Court.

Nvidia CEO warns AI won't cut work, humans may end up busierAmid the ongoing discussion on AI taking over human jobs, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang claims jobs will change, but it will be more hectic than ever.

sports.headline: Portugal set to hand Diogo Jota's number 21 kit to his close friend Ruben NevesPortugal will honour the late Diogo Jota by passing his iconic No. 21 jersey to close friend Rúben Neves, with coach Roberto Martinez calling it a gesture to keep Jota's dream alive on the pitch.

Rahul Dravid steps down as head coach of Rajasthan RoyalsIndian Premier League (IPL) franchise Rajasthan Royals announced on Saturday that it has ended its association with head coach and former skipper Rahul Dravid.

US Open, Day 7, Order of Play: Sinner, Swiatek eye fourth-round berthDay 7 of the US Open 2025 on Saturday, 30 August, wraps up the third round with title favourites Jannik Sinner, Iga Swiatek and defending champion Coco Gauff headlining the action in New York.

Cody and Brandi Rhodes surprise fans with second baby announcementCody and Brandi Rhodes welcome their second daughter, Leilani Ella Runnels in a surprise announcement, marking a new chapter for WWE's power couple.

Indian fan zones sold out 50 days ahead of series, says Cricket AustraliaCricket Australia has announced that the dedicated Indian fan zones at all eight venues for the upcoming white-ball series against India have been sold out.

Bumrah, Shubman Gill among others to undergo pre-season fitnes tests at COEIndia's Test skipper Shubman Gill has reached BCCI Centre of Excellence for fitness checks ahead of Asia Cup 2025. Jasprit Bumrah, Washington Sundar, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Mohammad Siraj and Shardul Thakur too are set to arrive at CoE for the mandatory pre-season assessment.

Brazil's best face off in VCT Game Changers final stage for Seoul spotThe Brazilian VCT Game Changers final stage begins in São Paulo, featuring the nation's top women's and marginalised-gender teams. The tournament's new qualification system adds pressure as only the champion qualifies directly for the 2025 Seoul Championship.

Digvesh Rathi, Nitish Rana fined for verbal spat in Delhi Premier LeagueDigvesh Rathi and Nitish Rana were fined heavily for their heated on-field clash during the DPL 2025 Eliminator. The duo were at loggerheads during the second innings of the match and had to be separated by umpires.

Team Liquid punch ticket to VCT EMEA Stage 2 grand final with win over BBLTeam Liquid edged past BBL Esports in a thrilling VCT EMEA Stage 2 playoff clash, booking their spot in the grand final. The result also confirmed Team Heretics' qualification for VALORANT Champions Paris 2025, while setting up a high-stakes lower bracket final tomorrow.

Djokovic jokes about injury after reaching US Open 4th round: Can't let rivals knowNovak Djokovic overcame a lower back injury to reach the US Open round 4. His victory makes him the oldest man to reach the last 16 since 1991.

RCB announce Rs 25 lakh financial aid for families of Bengaluru stampede victimsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) announced that it would provide Rs 25 lakh in financial assistance to each of the families of the 11 fans who died in the stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium on 4 June 2025.

Brazil's best face off in VCT Game Changers final stage for Seoul spotThe Brazilian VCT Game Changers final stage begins in São Paulo, featuring the nation's top women's and marginalised-gender teams. The tournament's new qualification system adds pressure as only the champion qualifies directly for the 2025 Seoul Championship.

Digvesh Rathi, Nitish Rana fined for verbal spat in Delhi Premier LeagueDigvesh Rathi and Nitish Rana were fined heavily for their heated on-field clash during the DPL 2025 Eliminator. The duo were at loggerheads during the second innings of the match and had to be separated by umpires.

Team Liquid punch ticket to VCT EMEA Stage 2 grand final with win over BBLTeam Liquid edged past BBL Esports in a thrilling VCT EMEA Stage 2 playoff clash, booking their spot in the grand final. The result also confirmed Team Heretics' qualification for VALORANT Champions Paris 2025, while setting up a high-stakes lower bracket final tomorrow.

Djokovic jokes about injury after reaching US Open 4th round: Can't let rivals knowNovak Djokovic overcame a lower back injury to reach the US Open round 4. His victory makes him the oldest man to reach the last 16 since 1991.

RCB announce Rs 25 lakh financial aid for families of Bengaluru stampede victimsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) announced that it would provide Rs 25 lakh in financial assistance to each of the families of the 11 fans who died in the stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium on 4 June 2025.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
